direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, seems like we actually may have just finally woken up. SARAH ROBERTSON comes to the door. SAM sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we look? Her look says it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you should stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all legit... the kid killed it. The formula is worthless. They all look at each other as if they have seen a ghost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are eight trillion dollars of paper around the world relying on that equation?? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 40   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean you were wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't even start.... This was discussed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm heading to the conference room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like you to hear this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... I don't want to hear this. SAM stares at them both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you think I've stuck around this place so long. He walks out of the room. SARAH and JARED look each other over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've called Tuld.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a contingency plan here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A contingency plan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We went all in on this one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we've got ourselves quite exposed here... haven't we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Tuld or the market?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

FREIGHT ELEVATOR HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS                      42 They cut through a short cut near the freight elevator. WILL, PETER, and SETH are coming down the stairway from the roof.

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

ELEVATOR BANK OUTSIDE JARED'S CONFERENCE ROOM - 44                                                                   44 CONTINUOUS The guys are taken aback because standing right outside the opening elevator door is a very well dressed page and a female executive assistant who is also dressed perfectly for the day ahead.

CEO'S EXECUTIVE BOARDROOM - CONTINUOUS 45                                                                   45 They come through glass doors and enter a massive conference room with a commanding view of the city. It is filled with people along one side of the table. There are a team of five lawyers, three compliance officers, a couple of key board members, twelve in all. On the near side of the table sits RAMESH SHAH surrounded by empty chairs all alone. The head of the table is empty. They all file in and sit down. They all sit in silence... waiting. Finally from a side door JOHN TULD comes walking into the room. He is dressed in a average suit and tie, is not tall, late fifties and doesn't have a hair on his head. He carries himself without much exception. His eyes however tell a far different tale. Intense even at rest. He walks the length of the room, everyone half stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please sit down. He then seats himself at the head of the table. Everyone in the room has the printout in front of them. JARED is seated immediately to his left, then SAM, then SARAH, RAMESH, WILL, PETER, and finally SETH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome everyone. I must apologize for dragging you all here at such an uncommon hour but from what I've been told this matter needs to be handled urgently, so urgently in fact that it probably should have been addressed weeks ago... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 45   CONTINUED:                                                       45 JOHN TULD (cont'd) but that is spilt milk under the bridge. So why doesn't someone please try to explain to me what's the problem here? Everyone looks around the room a bit and finally JARED speaks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Mr. Tuld as I mentioned earlier if you look here at the top page of this printout... He cuts him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jared, it's a little early for all that, how bout in English? ... Actually I'd like to hear from the guy who put this thing together... Mr. Sullivan is it? Does he speak English?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to speak to the analyst who seems to have stumbled across this mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's Peter Sullivan here. JARED looks down the table to PETER, as does everyone else in the room. JARED gives him a go ahead look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, there he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How old are you Mr. Sullivan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm twenty-seven sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please call me John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 45   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Mr. Sullivan why don't you tell me what you think is going on here, and please speak as you might to a young child or a golden retriever, I didn't get here on my brains I can assure you of that. PETER is very nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, sir. As I guess you may or may not know I work for Mr. Rogers here as an associate in the risk assessment and management office at MBS JOHN TULD Now you lost me at M...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was joking Mr. Sullivan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... Well as you probably know over the last 36-40 months the firm has begun packaging new MBS products that combine several different traunches of rating classification in one tradable security. This has been very profitable as I imagine you noticed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well the firm is currently doing a considerable amount of this business every day. The problem, which is I guess why we are here tonight, is that it takes us... the firm... almost a month to layer these products correctly thereby posing a challenge from a risk management standpoint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Mr. Sullivan that challenge is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to hold these assets on our books longer than we might ideally like to. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 45   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the key factor is these are essentially just mortgages, so that has allowed us to push the leverage considerably beyond what you might be willing, or allowed to do in any other circumstance, thereby pushing the risk profile without raising any red flags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how far have we pushed that profile tonight Mr. Sullivan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have pushed it to 1.215 Trillion dollars... at MBS alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give or take.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give or take.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now Mr. Sullivan what I am guessing, and give me a little rope here, what I am guessing that your report here says is that considering the, shall we say bumpy road, we've been on the last week or so that the numbers that your brilliant co- workers up the line ahead of you had come up with in the past don't seem to make much sense anymore considering what's taking place today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually not taking place today but what's already taken place over the last two weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what you're saying is it's already happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sort of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Mr. Sullivan what does your model say that means for us here? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 45   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's where it becomes a projection. But... PETER looks down at JARED for approval to go forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're speaking with me Mr. Sullivan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... sir... if those assets were to decrease by just 25 percent, and remain on our books... well... that loss would be greater than the current market capitalization of this company. The room goes silent. JOHN TULD looks at PETER long and hard. He then stands up and goes over to the window and looks into the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what you're telling me Mr. Sullivan is that the music appears to be about to stop and we are going to be holding the biggest bag of stinking shit ever assembled in the history of capitalism? Everyone looks back at PETER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Sullivan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well sir, I'm not sure I'd put it that way but let me clarify using your analogy, what this model shows is the music, so to speak, just slowing, if the music were to stop, as you put it, then this model would not be even close to that scenario. It would be considerably worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well let me tell you something Mr. Sullivan. Do you want to know why I'm sitting here in this chair with you all, why I get the big bucks, so to speak?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here for one reason and one reason only. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 45   CONTINUED: (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here to guess what the music is gonna do a week, month, a year from now. That's it, nothing more....... and I'm afraid... standing here tonight... that I don't hear... a... thing... just silence. The room falls completely still for at least half a minute. Then JOHN TULD spins around quickly with a considerably more upbeat tone and looks up and down the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, now that we know that the music has stopped, what can we do about it? Long Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Cohen, Ms. Robertson, I'm afraid this is where you are supposed to step back in. Lord knows we relied enough on Mr. Sullivan today. JARED and SARAH come to attention and gather their thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you got for us? Long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have I told you since the first day you walked into my office? (pause) That there are three ways to make a living in this business... Be first, be smarter, or cheat. Well I don't cheat, and even though I like to think we have got some pretty smart people in this building of the two remaining options, it sure is a hell of alot easier to just be first. The room goes silent again as Mr. Tuld stares back out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sell it all today... JOHN TULD smiles just a bit. Then turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that even possible Sam? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is, but at what cost?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pay.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost a trillion bucks of paper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where does it come back to us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bring the traders in for their normal

dialogue.raw_text: continues to look out over the city for a long beat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: looks across the room at JOHN TULD, they have known each other for 35 years.

direction.raw_text: :30 meeting and you be honest with them, they're gonna know it's the end either way, so you'd have to throw them a bone, and a pretty big one. You'd have to come out of the gate storming... 40 percent done by 10:15 and 70 percent of your positions need to be gone by eleven, cause by lunch the word will be out. No swaps, no nothing, and by two o'clock you'll be getting 65 cents on the dollar, if you're lucky, and the feds will be in here looking up your ass and trying to slow us down.

direction.raw_text: Ramesh? He looks to RAMESH SHAH down the table. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same people you've been selling this to for the last two years... and whoever else will buy it. They look at each other to see if they understand each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you do this you've killed that market for years. It's over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Nods.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you are selling something you know has no value.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cuts him off cold) We are selling to willing buyers at the current fair market price, so that WE may survive, Sam.

direction.raw_text: You'll never sell a thing to any one of them again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you!!! This is it, Sam, this is it! The rest of the table is taken aback and just watching them go at it. Silence.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have been trying to locate him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he is just out there with this information?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Nods yes.) JOHN TULD looks down the lawyer side of the table to a secret service looking guy.

direction.raw_text: Carmelo?
direction.name: direction

Long silence. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Really?

direction.raw_text: I can't say I feel that about anyplace actually.

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure John. This is really ugly.

direction.raw_text: You and I are salesmen Sam, we sell. That's what we do. It's not complicated.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You keep saying that, what is that supposed to mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the big one. Most of us aren't gonna make it out of this one. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A45   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This won't be the last `situation' I will be having this week. It's just the start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only the start because we are starting it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. But I don't think that's true, not this time. The numbers just don't add up anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I agree with you there, I've been saying that for years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean if this kid can come up with this...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think I can go in knowing what I know and put the hammer down on these guys like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh please, when did you become so soft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you soft, you're panicking. The word panic slaps JOHN TULD in the face. He then calms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're the first one out the door Sam, it's not called panicking JOHN TULD stares aggressively at SAM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I obviously don't have all the information that you do. But I think this could destroy this firm. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A45   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll never be trusted again. You are knowingly putting people out of business. Full stop. JOHN TULD turns away from SAM and heads over to a phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You let me take care of that. SAM heads out the door. INT. CEO'S GREETING LOUNGE - CONTINUOUS 46                                                                    46 Sam heads into the hallway where everyone is mingling. He walks over to WILL, PETER, and SETH.

direction.raw_text: How'd that go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a fucking shit show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are going to do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.

direction.name: direction

CEO'S TOP FLOOR ELEVATOR BANK - CONTINUOUS 47                                                                    47 JARED is waiting for the elevator again as SARAH walks up and waits with him in silence. There is a housekeeping person standing next to them as well. The doors open, and all three get in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ELEVATOR - CONTINUOUS 48                                                                 48 SARAH ROBERTSON So what's the strategy here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's where I'm headed right now, downstairs to work on it with my guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you and I... with Tuld.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure we need one, Sarah. That's not the way I've ever done this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with distinct sarcasm) Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows where we both have stood on this all along. There's nothing more to do. This pushes a button with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's exactly my point, and knowing what was discussed by both you and I with him, I don't see how that can possibly you with anything but a false sense of comfort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not looking for a sense of comfort here, Sarah. I don't think there is one to be found. The elevator door opens and the housekeeper gets off. Sarah walks after her, but turns to Tuld first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So again, what's the strategy here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's public record.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was worth a billion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll see. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Slight head shake no.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a little real air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably a good idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, is that alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I get out of here for a minute?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Are you kidding? It's not a prison. Do you want me to hold your hand? Peter exits. Will's phone rings. Will stares at it and finally picks it up. We only hear his part of the conversation.

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was Eric's wife. He's alive, he's home. He doesn't want to talk to us. And he doesn't know she called me. They all look to SAM to see what to do.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The heights. SAM ROGERS looks at his watch. (CONTINUED)

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... we are going to do this thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's going to be tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Sam on board?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah, I need a head to feed to these traders... and the board... this morning. SARAH looks up. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Have you ever done anything like this before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... never.... not even close. SAM takes a deep drag off his cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. PETER looks down at his watch, then thinks about what to say next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you really think this is the only... or the... right thing to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure. Now SAM looks around and thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So this is gonna make a pretty big mess of it, then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't even want to think about it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 62   CONTINUED: (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just doesn't quite seem... Takes another long drag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Very slightly shakes his head.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. I guess we should get back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. They both stand in place for a long beat then finally turn and head into the building. INT. LOBBY ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS 63                                                                   63 The camera follows them through the long marble lobby. Through security. They comfortably don't talk to each other the entire time till they get into the elevator. INT. ELEVATOR - CONTINUOUS 64                                                                   64 Staring ahead in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well good luck, you know, in the future... Seems like you'll probably be just fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. The doors open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FADE IN: INT. EXECUTIVE BATHROOM STALL 65                                                                   65 A very tight shot of SETH sitting fully clothed on the toilet with the lid on. He is crying very, very intensely but almost silently. He puts his head in his hands and just once or twice lets out a loud noise. (CONTINUED) 84. 65   CONTINUED:                                                     65 Eventually someone comes into the room and he hears the person go over to the sink and start running water. SETH tries to stop himself from crying. Eventually he accepts that the guy is not leaving and he comes out of the stall and walks over to the sinks. JARED is standing in front of the mirror with his shirt off shaving. His new shirt and tie are on a hanger next to him. SETH walks up to a sink next to him and it is very obvious that he has been crying. He undoes his collar and starts to wash his face. Finally JARED speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You alright? SETH sends him a dagger of a look through the reflection in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just fired me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is all I've ever wanted to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... This hits JARED just a touch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am sorry. JARED does up his tie perfectly looks at SETH again in the eye. Then walks out. INT. EXECUTIVE QUARANTINE ROOM - DAY 66                                                                   66 SARAH ROBERTSON is sitting in a club chair staring out the window. The coffee table in front of her has a huge spread of fruit and cheese and pastries. She is not eating. She sits and stares. Eventually the door behind her opens, and a SECURITY GUY walks in with ERIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are almost ready for you Ms. Robertson. Couple of minutes. SECURITY GUY leaves the room. ERIC looks over at SARAH then sits in the chair near her. Silence. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 66   CONTINUED:                                                    66 ERIC You as well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you... Sam and the rest of your floor are gone after today as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really... and Cohen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... still here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course... Long awkward pause. Eric looks around for something, anything to talk about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you still dating that tall guy... from the Christmas thing? She looks over at him with a slight smile, giving him credit for trying to break the ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was very tall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Silence. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 66   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did pass on your concerns last year... just so you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It does. The door swings open and a catering person comes in rolling a cart with another large tray with more food on it. She places it on the table next to the other food. The abundance is overwhelming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. The caterer leaves. ERIC looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have they taken all the phones out of this room? SARAH nods yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus. Paranoid fucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I didn't think they were going to be able to get you back here. ERIC stands up and goes over to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They told me they were going to drag me through hell on everything from my options to healthcare over the next two years or I come back and make... (he looks up and does a little math in his head) $176,471.00 an hour to sit in this room quietly... it wasn't much of choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It never is. ERIC goes back and sits in the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously looking back, the point was expressed with insufficient urgency... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 66   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but your point was passed on... I need you to know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand, there was nothing you could do. Now SARAH questions herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess... at the time... it didn't seem like there was much of a choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It never does. They both look at each other with miniscule smiles, then out the windows onto the city, defeated. Long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have kids, yeah? Long pause as he lets her alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is your package going to look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, that's what I'm waiting for now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should be pretty good, no?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It better be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. VIP TRADING ROOM - 6:30 AM 67                                                                   67 There are 40 young, 90% male, traders jammed into the conference room next to the trading floor talking very loudly with one another. They are oblivious to what is about to happen. Eventually, SAM, WILL, JARED, and a firm lawyer, come into the room. Everyone quiets down a bit. (CONTINUED) 88. 67   CONTINUED:                                                    67 WILL EMERSON Alright, hey...(whistles). They go silent as they notice SAM standing at the head of the table. JARED and the lawyer are standing off in the corner just to observe. SAM looks somber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you all for coming in a little early this morning, I know yesterday was pretty bad, I wish I could say that today is going to be less so but that isn't going to be the case. Now I am supposed to read this statement here to you all but how bout you read it on your own time and I'll just tell you what the fuck's going on here. THE LAWYER looks at JARED then they look at SAM, he continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have spent the night here meeting with the executive committee and the decision has been made to begin to unwind a considerable portion of the firm's holdings in several key asset classes. The crux of it is... in the firm's thinking the party is over as of this morning. There is going to be considerable turmoil in the markets for the foreseeable future. They believe that it is better to have this turmoil begin with us... as a result the firm has decided to liquidate the majority of its position of fixed income MBS today. An assistant starts handing out info packets to each of the traders in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should be getting a breakdown right now, you will see the accounts you are responsible for today. I'm sure it hasn't taken you long to understand the implications of this sale on your relationships with your counterparties and as a result on your careers. I have expressed this reality to the executive committee and they understand. As a result, if you are able to complete a 93% sale of your assets you will receive a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .4 million dollar one off bonus. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 67   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If the floor as a whole is able to achieve a 93% sale we all get an additional 1.3 million a piece. Because of this, if you burn through your allotment by noon, get moving around the floor and start picking up other guys leftovers... SAM stops for a second and looks around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For those of you who have never been through this before, this is what the beginning of a fire sale looks like. I don't have to tell any of you that the first hour and a half is going to be very important. I want you to hit every bite you can find. Dealers, clients, brokers, and your mother if she's buying...and obviously no swaps, its outgoing only today. This is obviously not the way any of us would like for this to be going down, but the ground is shifting below our feet, and there appears to be no other way out. SAM looks around the room again, person by person and sees that they indeed know what needs to be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously... this is a very unique situation... if we are successful today we will have been successful in destroying our own jobs... I can not promise that each of you will be repositioned within the firm, but I can tell you that I am very proud of the work we have done together here, I have been at this here for 34 years, and I know... from experience people are going to say some nasty stuff about what we have done here, and what you have devoted a portion of your life to. But have faith that in the greater picture our skills have not been wasted, we have accomplished much, and our talents have served some greater good... He looks down at the ground, then back up around the room. Then he walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 90. INT. TRADING FLOOR- 8:20 AM 68                                                                   68 There is a very quiet energy on the floor. A low murmur. Then a hush falls over the floor as people pass on the info that the CEO, JOHN TULD is about to come onto the floor. He appears at one end of the floor and it falls silent. JOHN walks dramatically into the middle of the floor and then into the middle of the row in the dead middle of the floor. He looks around and stands in letting the drama build. Then he climbs up onto the desk and looks out onto the floor like a general.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the end of today almost everyone else in the world, including me, will have considerably less money than they began the day with..... You, in this room, are the exception. You will leave here today richer. You will fire the first shot, I wish it didn't have to be, but at times the market must eat its weak, and you all... are not the weak. We must strike quick, with no doubt, if you hear pause on the line, attack. By noon the SEC is going to be in here getting in your faces, sniffing around, you let us take care of them and you just keep going. We own what we are choosing to sell today and there is nothing they can do about it. 107 years ago this firm was founded, today we secure our place for next 107. You've got two minutes before we get started. Let's finish this, so we can get on to the next one... JOHN TULD climbs down from the table. SAM, who is standing off to the side, walks along the entire floor slowly and then heads into his office. INT. SAM ROGER'S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 69                                                                   69 He shuts his door as the bell rings and his office goes almost silent. Through the glass you see the trading floor go wild, then he walks over to his desk, turns around and stares into the four large computer screens as the charts and graphs begin to move. We just see the back of his head. INT. INVESTMENT BANK TRADING FLOOR - DAY 70                                                                   70 Several actual individual trading sequences throughout the day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SAM ROGER'S OFFICE - 4:02 PM 71                                                                    71 The market has closed. SAM sits, staring at his computers. There is a knock on his door. He turns and as it opens we hear the sober beginnings of a quiet celebration. He looks up and JARED COHEN is standing in his doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They did alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to give you a heads up. They are going to start sending some people home out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (He nods yes) Sorry. No loose ends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what it's worth, you're good... Guess somebody upstairs must really like you. SAM stands up and walks past JARED without another word. INT. TRADING FLOOR HALLWAY - DAY 72                                                                    72 He heads down the hallway and passes the HEATHER and LAUREN BRATBERG from the opening scene who are returning with boxes to lay off more people. SAM heads off towards the elevator. INT. SENIOR EXECUTIVE DINING ROOM    - MOMENTS LATER 73                                                                    73 The room has ten tables formally set that line a long wall of floor to ceiling windows with a commanding view of the city beyond. The room is empty except for JOHN TULD sitting at the last table. TULD looks a little surprised to see SAM but waves him down. SAM approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, please sit. Congratulations are clearly in order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our guys did what they could. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 73   CONTINUED:                                                       73 JOHN TULD You did a hell of a job today, and I thank you for it. Sit, excuse me for eating but it's been a long day. Can I get you anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no thanks. They just sit in silence for a long beat as TULD takes a few more bites of his meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what can I do for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm done, I want out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been a very difficult day, for everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need you to release my options, that is if they're still worth anything after today, and I need the bonus. I'm out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get the bonus, the options, and keep your current base, but I need you to stay with me for another 24 months. O.K? They look at each other, SAM seems to know it's not actually a question. SAM is a shell of himself as TULD takes another hearty bite of his meal. He finally looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For God's sake man put a smile on your face, you did some good today, you said so yourself. I'm starting to feel a little better about this whole thing. You're one of the luckiest guys in the world, you could've been digging ditches all these years... SAM pushes back his chair, stands, and prepares to leave. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 73   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's true, and if I had been at least there'd be some holes in the ground to show for it. I'm just not quite sure how we fucked this thing up so badly. This pushes TULD a bit too far. He also senses he may be losing SAM. He drops his fork, and his tone changes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, when did you start feeling so sorry for yourself, it's unbearable... What, you think we may have helped put some people out of business today? That it's all just for naught? Well you've been doing that everyday for almost forty years Sam. And if all this is for naught then so is everything else out there. It's just money, it's made up, a piece of paper with some pictures on it so we don't all kill each other trying to get something to eat. But it's not wrong and it's certainly not any different today than it's ever been. Ever. 1637, 1797, 1819, `37, `57,`84, 1901, `07, 1929, `37, `73, and 1987... God damn did that motherfucker fuck me up good, 92, 97, 2000, and whatever this is gonna be called. They're just the same thing over and over. We can't help ourselves, and you and I can't control it, stop it, slow it, or even ever so slightly alter it... We just react... and we get paid well for it if we're right... and get left by the side of the road if we're wrong. There's always been and there's always gonna be the same percentage of winners and losers, happy fucks and sad sacks, fat pigs and starving dogs in this world... yes there may be more of us today... but the percentages... they always stay exactly the same. They stare at each other for a long beat and then TULD looks down and takes another bite. He chews. He looks up again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do it John, but not because of your little speech, but because I need the money. I'm not sure how it could possibly be after all these years, but I need the money. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 73   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're keeping the kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keeping him? He's getting promoted. It's all hands on deck now Sam, there's going to be a lot of money to be made coming out of this mess, we're going to need all the brains we can get around here. They look at each other one last time then SAM starts walking away and as he passes PETER he just gives him a slight nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We hear the sound of someone digging in dirt with a shovel. FADE IN: EXT. VERY UPSCALE OLD GROWTH SUBURBAN NYC BACKYARD- 11:00 PM 74 74 Fade up on SAM ROGERS standing in a hole in the backyard digging. Next to him is a large black medical-looking bag. He continues to dig. Eventually the flood lights from the house come on and the whole back yard lights up. Then the door opens and a woman in her fifties wearing a bath robe and slippers comes out onto the deck. It is SAM'S EX-WIFE. MARY ROGERS. She squints towards the back of the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello! ... I've called the police. SAM stops digging and looks up and leans on the shovel handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 74   CONTINUED:                                                       74 She comes down off the deck and walks across the lawn up next to the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ella died. MARY looks down and sees the large canine body bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tumor on her liver. It was horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I'm very sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I really loved that dog
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, but Sam you don't live here anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was driving home from the vet and this is the only place I could think to bury her. This is where she belongs... She looks at him deeply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. You should have called.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alright? You look terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Tough day all around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard, Sammy called.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he alright? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 74   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said they got hammered, but got out alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, I was going to call him this morning... but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I am going to go back in to bed. The alarm is on so don't try to break in. (Sam smiles) Well, you take care of yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it alright if I finish up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. MARY walks back across the lawn into the house and turns off the lights. SAM starts back in digging the ditch and starts humming a song. He keeps digging as the song he is humming then kicks in with the full version.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They both look at each other again, then look over and see JARED COHEN walking down the dining room aisle with PETER SULLIVAN next to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue
